data.title: Visitor Guide and Tourist Information
data.text:
Tourism

The town is an ideal place for a base when exploring the flood plain of the River Ouse and the rambling South Downs.

Attractions

Paradise Family Leisure Park â including Planet Earth Museum.

Newhaven Fort

Newhaven Local & Maritime Museum

Transport

Road - The A259 road passes through Newhaven and is an alternative to the A27. The town is the southern starting point of the A26 which runs up to Maidstone in Kent.

Rail â Newhaven is served by the branch line stretching from Lewes to Seaford. It has two stations, Newhaven Town and Newhaven Harbour.

Brief History

There is evidence of an Iron Age hill fort on Castle Hill. The Saxons on their invasion of England in 480AD settled in the area now occupied by the town. They named their village Meeching or Myching. The railway was brought to Newhaven in the mid 1800âs where the London, Brighton & South Coast Railway constructed a wharf. This made the town an important port for the shipping of freight. The harbour was dredged and made deeper around 1870 and so making suitable for cross-channel ferries to berth in the port. Newhaven was the major embarkation point for troops and equipment going to the Flanders battlefields during World War I. A large number of Canadian soldiers were stationed in the town before they were sent on the ill-fated World War II âDieppe Raidâ in 1942.

Famous People

Charles Deville Wells â The âMan Who Broke the Bank at Monte Carlo.â â Made famous in a song of that name. Lord Lucan â Thought to have stayed in the town whilst escaping from the police following the murder of his childrenâsâ nanny.

Approximate Population

The population of Newhaven in 2007 was 12,026

Nearest Tourist Information Centre
